data.message: stop re-ordering my newsfeed. Why does FB think it knows what my "top stories" are?

replies.message: Hey Gale. You can control what you see in News Feed by sorting the order that posts appear or creating lists to organize friends as you like. See how at: http://on.fb.me/1xSMjTG. -Chantal
I know how to do that. It keeps switching back on me. I don't want to create lists-I just want to see my newsfeed. I can't add groups to the lists.
You need to give us back the sort icon please!  I have always selected recent instead of top. Please add it back!

Well that was a record. It switched back to 'top stories' after just a day. WTH. Why can't 'recent' be the default and people who feel like facebook knows what they like (NOT me) can switch it to top stories.
